--- title: "First Post: Simple Chart" date: 2025-11-18 categories: [python, plotting] description: "Tiny example using pandas + matplotlib." image: images/first-post-card.png # optional, shows on grid cards --- Hereâ€™s a simple chart rendered statically. ::: {#4803c467 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import pandas as pd import matplotlib.pyplot as plt df = pd.DataFrame({"x": range(10), "y": [v*v for v in range(10)]}) df.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ```{=html}
x y
0 0 0
1 1 1
2 2 4
3 3 9
4 4 16
``` ::: ::: ::: {#179263c8 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} plt.plot(df["x"], df["y"]) plt.title("y = x^2") plt.xlabel("x"); plt.ylabel("y") plt.show() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](first-post_files/figure-html/cell-3-output-1.png){width=585 height=449} ::: :::
